Design and Economics is a programme of activities pulling together various threads around how design and economics connect, conflict, and shape each other.

  • Design and Economics is evolving, but right now we're focused on creating and curating resources; building a community; and supporting and running events. Get in touch if you think there are other things we should be doing.

  • Resources

    We're capturing our events, curating materials from our community and sharing them on our Notion site. If you have revelvant reading, viewing or listening to share just send it to us using this form.

  • Community

    Join the Design and Economics Group on LinkedIn for discussions and resource sharing. You can also find upcoming meetups on our Luma calendar.

  • Design and Economics has been shaped by ideas, guidance and input from Mark Simpkins, Simon Gough, Paul Sternberg, Sally Brazier, Victoria Hands, Jim Coleman, Joanna Boehnert, Tanvi Yardi, Kas Moreno Madrigal, Leonardo Gentili and Zarida Zaman.
